3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:13): Bert: I posted proposed times for our breaks on Sunday. Let me know if we want to change those
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:13): has nothing else planned for Sunday
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:13): Daniel: Can we schedule a walk on the Riviera for Sunday? We don't seem to have a very full agenda this time.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:13): Peter: Let's see how the agenda shapes up
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:14): Peter: David sent an email about commas being an error handling point

3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:14): David: The basic question is whether errors that are not inside an expression but are between commas cause only the stuff between commas to be ignored or the entire query list to be ignored
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:15): David: Given the way error handling inside a query, this makes sense.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:15): David: But Acid3 assumes the whole query is invalid
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:15): David: Which means we have several implementations that dot aht.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:16): David: I wanted to check that we should change our implementations
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:16): Anne: I agree this makes sense.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:16): Anne: The way Hixie has fixed Acid3 is by commenting out the test, so it wouldn't affect passing
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:16): Anne: Of course implementations would still have to change their behavior
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:16): Anne: Opera is willing to change
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:16): Peter: I assume Mozilla is willing to change. Microsoft?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:16): Anne: Microsoft doesn't have an implementation
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:17): Anne: That's the only outstanding issue
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:17): Melinda: Does WebKit have an implementation?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:18): Anne: Yes. I don't remember if Hyatt agreed with this change or not.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:18): Peter: I'm not hearing any opposition. Seems like a good idea to me.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:20): RESOLVED: No change to draft, accept commas as error-handling points.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:20): Anne: So, do we publish a Last Call draft now?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:21): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Yes, let's. Can we publish it before TPAC?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:22): Peter: We'd still need to extend the Last Call period so people have time to publish
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:23): RESOLVED: Publish Media Queries as Last Call, deadline for comments 4 weeks after TPAC
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:24): Peter: We had an internal meeting on the test suite harness at HP.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:24): Peter: Don't know how long we can have people working on it, so wanted to get comments.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:24): Melinda: It would be cool if everybody could give it a 1/2 hour spin
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:25): Peter: Biggest thing is need to work on reporting functionality

e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:25): (fwiw, I now filed the bugs on WebKit I listed in http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/css/20081007 so all three browsers have the bugs filed for the CSS Namespaces Module. Hopefully they're fixing soon :) )
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:26): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: hmm.. the prototype seems to be very out of date
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:26): Melinda, Peter: We'll send out a url when the latest and greatest is available

3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:27): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Also added ability to add a mode to the UA string: whether you are testing desktop screen, or projection mode, or print or print preview
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:27): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: so those can each get a different set of results
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:28): Melinda: I wanted to revisit Issue 74
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:30): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: I agree with adding "Avoid breaking inside a replaced element"
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:31): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: I'm not convinced about the other part
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:32): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: I'm concerned about breaking web layouts
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:32): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: which rely on floats and tables
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:33): Melinda: This whole section is fuzzily worded anyway
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:33): Melinda: we want implementations to think about what they're doing and do the best they can
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:34): Melinda: At some point we may evolve more rigorous rules here.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:34): Howcome: I think i agree that more rigorous rules would be useful, but at this point I don't know what they would be
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:35): Peter: where do we go from here?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:35): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Does anyone object to adding "Avoid breaking inside a replaced element"?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:36): RESOLVED: Add "Avoid breaking inside a replaced element" for Issue 74
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:36): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: I'm not terribly excited about the other stuff. I would prefer to leave it out of 2.1
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:37): Peter: I agree. If we're going to specify better page-breaking behavior, we should do that with explicit rules and properties.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:37): Peter: We should think about what should be the proper behavior and how do we give the author appropriate controls.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:38): RESOLVED: Don't add other sentence to 2.1
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:38): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: We have a couple issues that need testcases. If people could help with those...
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (19:39): Arron: We might have some written. I was going to take a look today.
